author: 89c4df800d6c50a3b2e4a4b1158192a7
content:
Action RPG that continues the original Persona 5 story (no Royal characters unfortunately), do you need more? Sure!
Great character moments, hanging out with the Phantom Thieves is as amazing as it always was, the new characters are delightful and just as impactful as the previous, and the story fits in perfectly into the P5 universe. The new designs are also P5 cranked up to MAX%!
Gameplaywise - I love it, it's very different and it does take some time to actually understand and enjoy it fully but after 2-3h it will click and it'll become super addictive. Just don't expect it to be NiEr: Automata levels of complexity and perfection.
It's a joy to play the combat sections and the exploration section where you just hang around in the real world.
If you enjoyed P5 or P5 Royal give it go!

author: c9924d6e7c7f55868257af9e8634b67a
content:
RESUMEN PARA LOS QUE NO QUIEREN LEER EL TOCHO:

Historia: 8/10 
Combate: 9/10
Gráficos: 8/10
Banda sonora: 9/10

Resultado final: 9/10

Puntos fuertes: Buena continuación de la historia original de Persona 5, con combate muy bien adaptado a tiempo real. Mantiene la esencia de Persona y se atreve a ir un poco más allá con combates con base musou pero profundidad similar a Final Fantasy VII Remake.

Puntos negativos: Mis únicas quejas serían el que la música extra de otros juegos de Persona sea un DLC aparte, y que comprar objetos en las tiendas sean tan caro para el poco dinero que ganas al principio. Tampoco entiendo el tener que pasar por dos pantallas de carga para recuperar toda la vida y estamina, ya que si el juego no iba a penalizar abandonar una mazmorra cuando queramos, podríamos haber tenido la opción de recuperarnos en un punto de control.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Más Persona de lo que pueda parecer a simple vista.

Es 100% seguro que váis a ver los tráilers y gameplays y pensar que esto es un musou con elementos de Persona 5 para machacar botones y hacer mil cosas en pantalla y ya, pero desde ya puedo decir que no es así.

La historia se sitúa seis meses después del final del Persona 5 original (Royal queda fuera de esta continuidad) por lo que Strikers vendría a ser la secuela directa de Persona 5. Debido a esto, en los diálogos se referencia a veces la trama del juego anterior y hay arcos de personaje que los spoilean con apenas dos frases, por lo que mi recomendación en este caso sería o bien que juegues a Persona 5 o que veas el anime de "Persona 5: The Animation", el cual es basura pero te vas a hacer una buena idea de la trama y aún así si luego quisieras jugar a P5 o P5R, seguirías sorprendiéndote con el juego.

Con las mecánicas jugables y el combate lo que han querido hacer es mantener las que ya había en Persona 5, pero adaptándolo todo al combate en tiempo real y a un mapeado más grande y con más verticalidad, lo que en mi opinión ha tenido muy buen resultado. Las mazmorras se dividen en mapas algo más pequeños, los cuales se irán desbloqueando conforme avance la trama del juego, y que si bien pueden pasarse yendo en plan comando, lo ideal y la mejor estrategia es, al igual que en Persona 5, buscar sorprender al enemigo para empezar el combate con ventaja. Hay un cierto componente de exploración pero el punto fuerte es que al igual que en Persona 4 Golden, habrá objetivos extra en las mazmorras que ya has superado conforme avances en la historia.

El combate puede parecer un machacabotones simplón y sin mucha necesidad de pensar en qué estás haciendo, pero para nada es así, precisamente todo lo contrario. Si bien hay mucho enemigo "de relleno" en pantalla (Los enemigos con máscara, sombras que no han mostrado su verdadera forma) los que hay que tener en cuenta y en los que debes enfocarte son las sombras ya tan reconocibles de la saga Persona y Shin Megami Tensei, ya que hacen más daño que los enemigos de relleno y pueden usar las mismas habilidades que los personajes principales (Ataques elementales y habilidades cuerpo a cuerpo).

Al principio todo se soluciona con un combo o dos y algún ataque de tu Persona, pero más pronto que tarde se ve que usar PE (Puntos de Estamina) a lo loco y atacar sin cabeza no es la mejor opción, ya que el combate tiene una profundidad que me recuerda mucho a Final Fantasy VII Remake, donde si bien es verdad que es un combate en tiempo real, también hay que ir con una estrategia en mente para cada enemigo y se puede pausar el combate para pensar en el próximo movimiento. Un punto fuerte que diría de este sistema es que la mecánica del "1-more" y los "All-out attacks" siguen existiendo en Strikers, siendo que ahora el "1-more" permite realizar un ataque gratuito a un enemigo al que le hemos golpeado con su debilidad pero que no ha quedado expuesto, mientras que el "All-out attack" es un ataque de área con todos los miembros del grupo si un enemigo queda expuesto. A destacar que el modo difícil no es añadir más enemigos y ya, se pone a prueba si de verdad controlas las mecánicas o si vas a recibir daño por intentar fliparte.

Otra cosa a destacar es que en Strikers no existe la gestión del tiempo ni los "Social Links", ya que por un lado se excusa que son las vacaciones de verano y no había necesidad de poner límites de tiempo, dado que la historia avanza conforme cumplas los objetivos y no teniendo que llegar a X objetivo en tantos días dentro del juego mientras que por otro lado el juego asume que has jugado a Persona 5 y que has maximizado todos los Social Links, por lo que aquí se sustituyen por el sistema de "Vínculos", que son habilidades pasivas que ayudan a progresar pasivamente a los personajes y dan bonificaciones tras ciertas acciones.

Gráficamente no hay mucho de lo que hablar, es más Persona 5 tanto gráficamente como en la UI del juego y la versión de PC se ve bien y apenas he tenido un problema o dos con alguna textura de una pared durante un diálogo. El juego está capado a 30 ó 60 frames, sin posibilidad de poder desbloquear el framerate, y la única vez que he tenido un tirón de frames fue durante un combate donde varios enemigos lanzaron Zio todos a la vez, pero por lo demás es una experiencia muy pulida y con un framerate estable.

La banda sonora es una maravilla, tanto los temas nuevos como los remixes más cañeros de los temas originales de Persona 5, como "Last Surprise" o "Rivers In The Desert". Mi recomendación en cuanto al doblaje es que si entiendes bien el inglés uses este, el cual no tiene nada que envidiarle al japonés (Ryuji MVP, fight me) y además durante los combates Morgana va dando consejos y hay conversaciones que ocurren durante estos y no es la mejor idea centrarse en leer los diálogos que salen arriba a la derecha mientras estás ocupado dándote mamporros con los enemigos.

Fácilmente un 9/10. Tiene sus cosas buenas y malas, pero puedo afirmar que "Persona 5: Strikers" ha sabido mantener la esencia de la saga Persona mientras que al mismo tiempo ha cogido como base los combates de los musou y les ha dado una vuelta de tuerca, adaptando las mecánicas de RPG y sigilo de Persona 5 con un muy buen resultado.

author: bd6fcf94a9245d4a8eec5a407dd6c97a
content:
If you played and enjoyed Persona 5, this is a must play. ATLUS and KT Games succeed in mixing the Dynasty warriors gameplay of their games with the quality of worldbuilding, strong characters, good writing and sharp art design of Persona 5.
The Gameplay is action heavy and not too complex but still somehow engaging and nice to look at.
The game completely lacks the life sim of Persona and makes the time of the game play out as you complete specific story events. You can expect dynasty warriors gameplay but with a Persona Twist as you are able to stop time and attack your opponent(s) with a wide variety of physical and magic moves, that have different types, just like in a Pokemon Game. This adds a leven of complexity to the gameplay and preparation (SP).
The Game features FANTASTIC MUSIC both new and from the Persona 5 game. Also it features the good UX design from P5.
The game runs well on my 3070 at 4k60 max settings and my friends report a good experience even on dated Hardware like the 1060, you can expect 1080p60 max settings with a solid bit of overhead here.
The only thing that is a bit of a mixed bag is the difficulty, there are some spikes that could have been balanced better, and the UX during fights. (sometimes there is just tooo much happening on screen to see what your character is doing)
If you didn't play Persona 5: THIS GAME CONTAINS SPOILERS for that game and the Story does not properly explain the core concepts of Persona, that you need in order to understand everything well!!
All in all Persona5 Scramble: The phantom Strikers is a good game, that hase some flaws but is a mostly enjoyable experience.
You schould absolutely play it if:
- You played and enjoyed Persona 5 and you desperately want to immerse yourself in that world again.
- You like Dynasty Warriors Gameplay and have a solid idea of what Persona is all about
Yopu should avoid it if:
- You are looking for a straight up Persona 5 sequel with life sim and all, this game is not that
- you want ultra deep and complex Gameplay that is easy to learn, hard to master
- You have never played a Persona Game or don't know what persona even is

For me PERSONALLY tha game is a 7/10

content:
Disclaimer: I can only recommend this game if you have already played Persona 5 (Base or Royal) because knowing the events beforehand is too important.

This game has all the level Persona 5 storytelling and the main cast that you probably enjoy. This game's twist is basically that it turns the traditional turn based Persona system into a stylish and dynamic real-time RPG with some hack-n-slash elements. Also this game is definitely quite easy until the ending where it gets somewhat challenging so I recommend to play on Hard which honestly feels kind of easy for someone new to the genre. Another gripe is that the game right now as a crashing issue and I see other people are experiencing it too - personally I have crashed like 7-8 times during my gameplay (usually when fast-travelling) so I HIGHLY recommend saving whenever you can until this issue is resolved. If you can look past these flaws, The story is solid, you'll get your values worth with ~40 hours of content, and the game is legitimately fun and addicting. 

8/10

author: e8d27de707cc5634828425de6a1f488f
content: This is a great sequel and spin-off of P5, it takes place after the events of P5 and has a completely new combat system. It takes a spin bringing main elements from musou games and combining it with persona. However if you're familiar with Persona 5, you can form bonds with individual characters and form special relationships. But, the confidant system is different and not as full fledged. So you can't romance up any characters sadly, would've loved to romance Sophie for the laughs. Fusing Personas are ultimately the same as in p5. The dialogue and character building is as expected of a persona game, pretty darn good. The monarchs, which are the villains who control a jail, each have tragedy in their past that led them to do wrong which makes the player not view them as pure evil but actual human beings. Honestly, this is such a 'lax and fun take on the p5 franchise, recommend it all the way.

author: 6776296ba1b455a9b33213296740c6a7
content:
The closest thing we'll get from Persona 5 on PC until Atlus ports the thing itself or (preferably) the Royal remake.

Overall, the game is great. It is basically Persona 5-2, but with a complete change in gameplay. If you enjoyed the original game, this title is a must. I'd say this is an almost perfect adaptation from the turn-based style to a hack-and-slash type of game, keeping the same Shadows weaknesses, strengths and spells.

However, it has its flaws. By the time I'm writing this review the game kept crashing randomly, either while loading a new in-game rendered cutscene (which can make you lose quite a bit of progress in the first dungeons) or when entering a Jail. The Anti-Aliasing messes with the text a bit (not something that makes the game unplayable, but it feels a bit weird). 

The Keyboard and Mouse Button Configuration is also severely lacking. It's not as bad as only having preset controls like Mega Man Zero/ZX Legacy Collection, but anything to the right of "Enter" is unbindable, which means anyone who uses the Arrow Keys will have a really hard time playing unless they have a controller.

But still, the game is awesome and well worth of being a sequel to Persona 5.

author: 125fc2eca2c85e749354561ed1cce876
content:
Persona 5 Strikers, ou Scramble, si vous suivez le jeu depuis sa sortie initiale au Japon, est une séquel quelques mois après les évènements de Persona 5.

Le gameplay est radicalement différent de ce que proposait P5, puisqu'il se rapproche d'un MUSO, quid donc du tour par tour.
Malgré tout, on retrouve les personas, et toutes les stratégies qui vont avec, c'est à dire pouvoir briser la défense d'un adversaire en utilisant les bons arts.

Persona 5 Strikers n'est pas Persona 5.
Il faut être honnête, il est décevant. Son histoire est assez tâche, puisqu'on suit les Voleurs Fantomes en vacances dont chaque arrêt se résumera par une nouvelle prison à explorer (les nouveaux palaces du jeu), ceci à de nombreuses reprises, et sans chaque fois réinventer la formule.
Le sel de Persona était sa découverte de nouveaux personnages, la tension à cause des limites de temps et surtout l'usure des combats au fur et à mesure de notre progression.
Ici, tout se boucle en 3 jours, car tout est scripté, les sorties, les affinités, les passages dans les prisons, et il suffit de sortir et revenir dans la prison dans une même journée pour terminer ce qu'on a débuté.
Bref, n'attendez pas de ce Persona d'être Persona, car il le fait mal.

Le gameplay est excellent, les combats sont dynamiques, nerveux et pétillent de partout.
La DA de Persona ajouté à ce gameplay donne une aura sublime et propre à la license qu'on ne peut qu'apprécier.
Les boss sont impressionnants et sont assez relevés, mais les passages de protection lors de piratages sont exquis, tant ils permettent de se défouler et de montrer son plein potentiel face à des hordes impressionnantes d'ennemis.

Côté technique, le jeu pêche pas mal puisque le chargement de lancement du jeu est INTERMINABLE, même avec d'excellentes configs.
De plus, à quelques reprises, il m'est arrivé de crash en voulant entrer dans les prisons, et enfin la technique reste à la ramasse, autant que Persona 5, sachant rappelons le que celui-ci est un jeu cross platform PS3/PS4, vous avez donc un aperçu de ce que donne cette suite, et c'est bien dommage.

Niveau histoire, le jeu est assez terne, puisque comme vu plus haut, les histoires se finissent vite.
Une prison correspond à 3 jours environ pour certaines, et on passe tout au plus une semaine entre la rencontre de l'antagoniste et sa métanoia.
Ceci est justifié par des vacances qu'il faut activement terminer, mais j'aurai préféré qu'on diminue le nombre de prisons (que je ne révélerai pas) pour des passages plus longs, mais plus intenses et plus proches de ce que la license proposait.
Heureusement, chaque fin de prison est émouvant, et rappelle subtilement pourquoi la license est aussi bonne, sa construction des personnages, et leur évolution suite à leurs drames.

Enfin, la BO est exceptionnelle !
Elle est en grande partie constituée de musiques de Persona 5, mais tous les thèmes de combat ont été revus, et il y'a énormément de bonnes surprises dans les nouvelles.

En somme, Persona 5 Strikers est un plutot bon jeu, avec une DA et une BO toujours exceptionnelles, malheureusement terni par de nombreux défauts, qui n'en font pas moins un mauvais jeu, mais il reste le moins bon persona auquel j'ai pu jouer.

Bref, fans de la première heure, foncez sans en attendre quoi que ce soit, et néophytes, jouez d'abord à Persona 5 qui vous donnera sans broncher une expérience parfaite avant d'entamer celui-ci !

去年6月份刚在PS4上入了一份P5S，没想到今年年初就上PC了。 那就再买一份把:)  (希望P5R也能上PC)

content:
Bien que le gameplay soit très différent je pense que l'on peut considérer Persona 5 Strikers comme le digne successeur de Persona 5.

Le gameplay justement - bien plus orienté action que le jeu d'origine - et malgré cette fusion de style que l'on pourrait considérer contre-intuitive, se prend bien en main et semble bien poli. En bref il se laisse apprécier (Je ne suis pourtant pas du tout connaisseur de ce type de jeux).

Rien à dire vis à vis du port PC ça marche très bien, et pour ce qui est du jeu je ne lui ai pas encore trouvé de point négatif.
Correction, en 20 heures de jeu j'ai eu deux crash en sortant ou rentrant dans une jail .

Il ne reste plus qu'à attendre le portage PC de Persona 5 Royal pour peu qu'il arrive un jour.
(attention cependant, en terme de continuité d'histoire le développement de Persona 5 strikers a commencé avant la sortie de Royal, la trame scénaristique est donc la suite du Persona 5 original. Y aura-t-il un Persona 5 Strikers Royal cela reste à voir)

author: d112feb6315a55c08e87ff34fcf2d0ff
content:
Persona 5 Strikers a good mix between the depth of Persona 5's turn based mechanics, and horde based action.

For PC only players, this is not a good place to get into Megami Tensei and Persona. There are a few (indirect) spoilers for it's prequel. Additionally, the gameplay (while good) doesn't give you a good idea for how a regular Megami Tensei game plays.

If you're new to the series, I'd recommend you play Persona 4 Golden or Shin Megami Tensei: III Nocturne HD Remaster on Steam. You can also wait for the (very likely) announcement of a Persona 5 Royal port.

The port isn't terrible, but it's not good either: Performance is good. Settings are barebones. The anti aliasing setting is bad. It's a basic on or off switch, and it looks very jaggy. Be sure to mod in something that smooths out the game. Resolution scaling doesn't change until you alt + tab in and out of the game. The game runs really good and without frame drops (that I could notice anyway, and I'm using a GPU that was considered mid range 5 years ago).

I will update with an in depth review after I've finished the game.

author: 4d55bc60277a5a7cb171921e5d01131a
content:
I highly suggest you play Persona 5 or Royal first before Strikers because there are way too many references to the older games, and it is extremely confusing for newer players.

With that out of the way, do not expect a story like Persona 5 or Royal. Instead, come into it expecting a summer vacation with a bunch of your pals. It's a much more lighthearted story that makes you spend more time with the Phantom Thieves all around Japan.

Speaking of going around Japan, HOLY COW THERE IS SO MUCH FOOD TO BUY AND MAKE. IT'S HONESTLY THE BEST THING EVER. It feels like a real vacation to go from place to place. It's so refreshing, and it's a whole lot of fun finding out what's the next location.

Absolutely not as good as the mainline entries, but this spin-off is absolutely worth your time if you enjoyed 5 or Royal.

author: c2944c0cdd515cb0a25b4f641b607c4e
content:
우선 저는 페르소나 4만 플레이하고 5는 플레이 못 해봤어요. 거기다 4도 그렇게 재밌지는 않아서 페르소나류에 대한 기대보단 재밌는 무쌍류에 대한 기대감으로 시작.

실제 게임은 무쌍이라기 보다 이스 8에 가까운 느낌이더군여. 개인 적으로 재밌게 했지만 버그가 꽤 있는 편이고 포팅은 코에이치곤 낫지만 별로입니다. 
---------------------------
스토리는 옛날옛적 파랜드 사가도 1보다 2를 먼저 했고 배급사도 큰 문제 있으면 5를 내고 냈겠지라 생각하고 시작했습니다. 하다보니 스토리는 4스럽게 정신과 가야 될 인간들을 폭력으로 갱생시킨 뒤 동료로 삼는 스토리로 추정되니 딱히 이해엔 문제 없었습니다. 다만 이걸 하고 5를 하면 5 스토리가 겁나 재미없어 질 거란 것엔 동의합니다.

개인적으론 페르소나 스토리 별로 안 좋아하고 이번도 별로였어요. 위에 얘기했듯 직장이나 사회에서 불이익 받을까봐 정신과를 안 가는 동아시아의 답답함을 잘 보여주고 문제 해결이 [spoiler] '야구로 보답하겠습니다'[/spoiler] 거든요 -_-
--------------------------------------
전투: 잡졸을 수수경단 베듯 베고, 적 네임드 캐릭을 공중으로 띄운 뒤 일방적으로 콤보 퍼붓는 과정은 굉장히 적습니다. 메인 컨텐츠는 보스전이라 생각하는데 노멀 난이도에서도 다크소울마냥 때리는 시간보다 피하는 시간이 더 길 정도로 난이도가 있는 편. 때문에 무쌍 시리즈를 기대했다면 별로일 수 있을 거라 봅니다. 다만 무쌍의 평타 N회 후+차지로 기술을 쓰고, 필살기가 있다는 기본 구조는 유지하고 있습니다. 여기에 더해 다음과 같은 페르소나 요소가 들어갑니다.

다른 게임의 스킬에 해당하는 페르소나: 주인공의 경우는 이걸 합성 및 강화를 해서 본인의 스탯 뻥튀기와 속성 바꾸기가 가능.
약점 속성: 적의 약점 속성을 찌르면 동료나 내가 피격 불가능한 상태를 유지하며 한 방 더 때리기 가능. 약점이 찔리면 쉴드가 깎이는데 다 깎으면 총공격이란 세미 필살기가 터짐. 한 캐릭에 익숙해지기 쉬운 무쌍에서 서로 다른 캐릭을 쓰도록 유도하는 요소인데 개인적으로는 좋게 봤어요. 
시간 멈추고 아이템 사용 가능.

주인공 파티는 4인으로 구성되어 있으며 실시간으로 조작 캐릭을 변경가능합니다. 마음에 안 들었던 점은 파티에 나간 캐릭에 경험치를 주는데 주인공은 파티에서 제외 불가능하며, 내가 조종 안 하는 캐릭들도 전투에 참여하며 맞아 죽을 수 있다는 점. 보스전은 언제나 다 죽고 레벨 가장 높은 주인공 혼자서 발악하는 플롯이더군요.

그래도 난이도는 적당히 할만한데 엔딩 후 BAND 레벨 노가다는 좀 싫었습니다. 보고에 따르면 15시간 동안 마지막 보스 잡아야 한다는군요.
--------------------------------------
편의성 및 버그

게임이 자동세이브를 지원 안 하는데 크래시나서 꺼지는 경우 꽤 있어요. 던전 안에서는 세이브 포인트에서밖에 세이브 안 되기에 빡침.

밴드 포인트 올리는 창 등에서 간헐적으로 프리징 걸려 죽을랑 말랑 하다가 살아나는 순간 있음. 이때 작업 관리자보면 평소에 CPU 10퍼 정도 먹던 게임이 CPU 100퍼를 다 쳐먹고서 낑낑대고 있더군요.

일단 마우스를 지원하고 시점변화도 마우스로 되는데... 마우스 UI가 안 나옵니다. 뭐 당연히 평타는 왼쪽 클릭, 차지는 오른쪽이겠죠. 휠 키가 필살기에 해당하는 N입니다. 네, 평상시에 애들한테 말 걸 때 휠키 클릭해야 합니다. 또한 모든 키보드 키를 지원하는 것도 아니어서 H 눌러서 텍스트 창 빨리 넘기기 등 몇몇 기능은 마우스에 대응하는 키를 눌러서 사용 할 수 없습니다.

페르소나 스킬 사용하는 창에서는 위 아래가 wsad가 아니고 화살표입니다. 위에 얘기했듯 오른손은 마우스에 가 있기 때문에 매번 이거 조정하겠다고 마우스에서 손 때서 키보드로 가는 거 기분 나쁨.

하다보면 코에이 치고 노력은 했는데 쾌적한 포팅은 아니라고 생각합니다.
--------------------------------------
뻘글

이름 입력하라고 해서 습관처럼 영어식인 first name, last name으로 입력했으나 실제로는 성 이름이라 애들이 날 모두 성으로 부르는 참사가 벌어짐.

메뉴 그래픽을 세련됐다 느낀 편인데 왠지 코에이 디자인은 아닐듯

author: 479975cbd73b5099bdf2254e26f2247b
content:
Persona 5 Strikers certainly is a worthy successor to Atlus' 2017/2020 masterpiece.

The Phantom Thieves' sequel story was a joy the whole way through, and I'm incredibly happy to have been apart for it.  The writing is on par with the original and Royal, and while this game is more of a "fan service-y" type deal, Atlus made sure to not forget about what made Persona 5 great in the first place, creating a fun road trip adventure that didn't need to be told, but I'm glad it was. Seeing the thieves older and wiser while also keeping their charm and traits from the original mad me smile, and allowed me to truly see just how much these characters have grown. 

The Musou style combat mixed in with Persona turn based elements came together perfectly, and while the camera can be a but weird sometimes, the combat always remained fluid and fun and never got boring even until the very end of the game. Persona fusion also makes a return, and while I have my quarrels with the new PP system, Persona Fusion is still crazy fun to do, allowing the player to create some incredibly OP Persona's that just shred enemies to a fine shadow-y paste. 

I became a huge Persona fan after playing Royal back in August. I never really was a JRPG guy, but for some reason Persona 5 always peaked my interest, and when I finally played it I fell in love. The Phantom Thieves are probably my favorite cast of video game characters period, and after 6 months of playing through the entire franchise, I was incredibly happy to be with the thieves on another adventure. I just hope this isn't their last.

author: f97adc70e1c45fbcae394494d8529a76
content:
FIRST OF ALL A WARNING:
[b]DO NOT PLAY THIS IF YOU HAVEN'T PLAYED PERSONA 5 ALREADY AND ARE STILL PLANNING TO AT SOME POINT IN THE FUTURE! THIS GAME NOT ONLY CONTAINS MAJOR SPOILERS, BUT ALSO BUILDS DIRECTLY ON THE PLOT OF P5 AND HEAVILY REFERENCES IT![/b]

With that out of the way, here's what a Persona Veteran and someone who's played through both P5 *and* P5R twice respectively, thinks of P5S so far:

Biggest and most obvious change compared to the main series game is the combat system; instead of using the incredibly perfect turn-based combat approach from the main series, Strikers instead uses a realtime buttonmashing/Dynasty Warriors-ish kind of approach.

When I first heard that, I was pretty disappointed, because Persona and turn-based just go hand in hand, and for very good reason.

After having played it for myself, the first two hours or so I was still pretty on the fence, because it really was mostly button-mashing, and as I expected, the camera is a major hassle unless you lock on to a single enemy within a crowd of dozens.

The good news however is that it does get somewhat better over time, i.e. with story progress; you'll get environmental interactables that allow for special attacks, ranging from dashing onto a  lamp post to slide down with a wild spin-kicking tornado attack, to jumping on skateboards and just mowing down entire platoons of enemies, or even using stuff like oversized party poppers to bombard them from a distance.
So what the combat system lacks in tactical depth and detailed strategic combat gameplay, it reasonably makes up for in crazy and fun blowing-off-steam kind of combat escapades.

As for the story, it stays true to what we've seen in Persona 5, being a very well-written narrative with deeply emotional moments, philosophical questions, plot twists, as well as an overall theme that carries through 'til the end.

I won't go into further details for obvious spoiler reasons, but suffice it to say that if you've loved P5's story, then'll you'll probably love P5:S's just the same, especially since the characters themselves reference a lot of the main storyline's key moments, and reminisce about the nostalgia of it all at pretty much the same time as you, the player, get that very same nostalgic feeling about encountering the main cast again.

The new members of the Phantom Thieves are also very intriguing and very well written (though one more so than the other, in my opinion), so look forward to discovering just what these two wil become over the course of the 25 - 35 hours of playtime.
All in all, this really feels much more like an addon to P5, story-wise, if not gameplay-wise, rather than "just" a spin-off.

There is some bad news too, however, namely in the [b]total lack of social/time management gameplay[/b] that is so typical of the Persona main series games.
Strikers, sadly, is 100% linear, and fully scripted ... there's only one singular instance in the entire game where you can actually choose with whom to go on a ferris wheel ride, and that's it.
No romance, no confidants, nothing.

The same, equally sadly, goes for the Requests; compared to Persona 5 proper, in Strikers they are really, really uninspired, with 90+ percent consisting of generic fetch quests, or equally generic "Kill X of Y in Z" quests.

As I said (yelled from the rooftops :P) in the beginning, in my opinion, this game should only be played if you've already played through Persona 5 on console.

If you haven't yet, much of this game won't make much sense to you... you won't get any of the "en passant"-references, you won't really understand the major story references in highly emotional moments, and you don't even know the main cast at all, since Strikers doesn't bother to (re-)introduce them, instead expecting you to already know who they are, what they went through, how they became Phantom Thieves... you'd basically get thrown into a road trip of a group of extremely tight-knit friends whom you've never seen before in your life.

And, again, the most important warning goes out to those of you who are still planning to play P5 eventually, maybe waiting for a potential PC release, or until they can afford console or game, or whatever:

[b]Do _not_ play P5:S beforehand, it _will_ ruin large parts of the Persona 5 story and experience for you![/b]

author: 6fe11ca0e1225b4e842b79b08a2edec3
content: I've logged over 160 hours into Persona 5, it's in my top 3 favourite games. It's so cool to see a direct sequel with a similar concept. It's very fun to see this game take place in an action Musou format rather than an RPG. It kind of adds to the immersion in a way. Super charming to see the gang back together stealing twisted desires. Something I appreciate about this game is that it's not *just* a Warriors game, but it really feels like a bite sized Persona game with the life sim mechanics. Persona on PC in general is eye candy and super convenient to just boot up since I'm usually using my computer every day.

Since I get to spend with Yusuke makes this game great.
Sadly there's isn’t as much life to explore stuff as it mostly focuses on story so no romance
And it’s a direct sequel to persona 5 not royal so no Kasumi :(
Like the previous game, the art is excellent in characters, scenes and the menu. Music is fantastic by remixing and adding to the P5 soundtrack, it feels nostalgic but different so it doesn’t get boring from what you listened to for hours in the previous game. author: 6f99771e639e5a939ff64b8833afad99
content:
This is a short review about mostly the PC Port of the game.

Pros:
Persona on PC

Cons:
60fps lock
No ultrawide support
Not a lot of PC specific settings (e.g. no FOV silder)
Hardcoded Resolutions (leads to a blurry upscaled picture on my setup)
Dated looking Graphics (e.g. Backgrounds are often not very detailed, textures are not that sharp, lightning does not look great)
UI looks bad (and is not customizable) but more importantly often covers a HUGE chuck of the screen
Randomly long loading screens (Game takes anywhere between 10 seconds and 2 minutes to start)
Mouse emulates a joystick leading to weird mouse controls (I had/have to use a controller)


TLDR: In my opinion not worth anywhere near 60 dollars on PC

author: bcce51407b61508792228c10d9957759
content:
Для незнакомых с игрой Persona 5, лучше пока что не покупать Strikers, вы абсолютно ничего не поймёте. Лучше дождитесь оригинала. Strikers на PC в данный момент как своеобразный закрытый клуб для тех кто шарит хоть немного за то что было в оригинале. Выпускать сиквел раньше оригинала это абсолютно гениальное решение, но имеем что имеем

"Заранее соглашусь что Strikers чувствовала себя местами плохо на PC, очень часто вылетала во время загрузок. Постоянно приходилось переигрывать по 30+ минут геймплея из за периодических вылетов. Разработчики выпустили несколько патчей исправляющих вылеты, так что надеюсь вылетов больше в игре нет

Persona 5 Strikers шедевральный сиквел шедевральной Persona 5 и теперь пройдя игру я могу сказать это с полной уверенностью. На просторах интернета витает выражение что это не та самая полюбившаяся всем персона 5 - Но это не совсем так. Persona 5 Strikers по прежнему та самая игра, про тех самых Фантомных Воров и сделана она с той же самой любовью что и оригинал, в каждом своём аспекте. Да поменялась боёвка, поменялась RPG составляющая, изменился в целом игровой процесс - Но как по мне Strikers от этого только выиграла, она получилась достаточно самобытным сиквелом на фоне оригинала. По ходу игры я всё больше и больше ловил себя на мысли что я получаю бесконечное удовольствие от этой игры. А ближе к концу игры я наконец то осознал - Чёрт возьми, а ведь я и правда играю в Персону 5, да в сиквел, но в Персону 5 и я даже не сплю. С релиза оригинальной персоны на консолях прошло уже почти 5 лет, и я все эти 5 лет просто ждал, это ожидание в какой то момент уже казалось бесконечным (Эмулятор в 30 кадров не выход) - Но прошлым летом всё изменилось. Atlus неожиданно без объявления войны релизнули Persona 4 Golden в стиме, после чего я купил её и прошёл трижды, а теперь вот Persona 5 Strikers заглянула к нам в стим и я считаю что это очередной повод порадоваться что серия Persona перебирается на PC и на другие платформы. В общем в заключении хочу сказать что вылеты могут пофикситься патчами, а надежда на Persona 5 Royal на PC теперь достигла своего пика. И да, оригинал я не проходил и скажу так - Тут хватает спойлеров сюжета оригинала, но спойлеров боятся в шедевры не играть, так что я прошёл и решил взглянуть на сюжет под другим углом. 

P.S Спасибо Atlus и Sega за то что начали портировать свои шедевры на PC. Сначала Persona 4 Golden вышла в стиме, теперь вот Persona 5 Strikers, все затаили дыхание в ожидании Persona 5 Royal и Persona 3 на PC. Теперь осталось только дожить до этого момента

author: 739ac699759858ab93feff98f6758f5b
content:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=upIOS1ckMKA

A great sequel to the original Persona 5 game, with the return on old characters and introducing new ones. It's got an interesting story with the phantom thieves as you fight evil and go on summer vacation with the gang. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2405199046

The mouse and keyboard controls are pretty decent though playing with a controller is a lot more comfortable. The combat is quite fun with the hack n slash style with the characters having their own unique mechanics, it gives the gameplay a bit more fun as you take down the waves of enemies. The atmosphere of the game is great with the many interesting characters and dialogue to read and listen to with the excellent japanese and english voiceovers. Visuals are nice with well animated anime cutscenes as well as the ingame details. Music of course are also bangers. It is most definitely worth it for those who are a fan of the Persona franchise and Persona 5 in particular. Here's hoping that Persona 5/Persona 5 Royal also comes to steam.

Also lewds
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2405151806

author: 731d2f8620b35f8ca6593de79fe27d20
content:
One of the best musou game I've played. If you can even call it that...

P5S is a perfect hybrid of what RPG and Musou should look like. 

Faithful to the original game, but adding elements from warriors games to make combat fluid while maintaining difficulties and challenges (If you attack enemies without exploiting their weaknesses, prepare to get destroyed). Coupled with banger soundtracks both new and remixed, this is the game I'm more than happy to pre-order and pay full price for!

Would avoid if you've not played Persona 5 as it contain major spoilers but otherwise, this is definitely a strong contender for my GOTY.

author: bd8dfc85c4555ed6882caf574e201852
content:
Looking cool, Joker!

A really fun sequel to the original Persona 5, continuing the story 6 months after the original game, and mostly keeping up with the standards for story set by its predecessor, albeit retreading many of the same paths, leaving the plot extremely derivative of the original, though making up for that in strides with its characters!

With an action-based combat system similar to the Dynasty Warrior games, the classic Persona fusing mechanics, and a whole heap of style, the combat is a joy to experience, especially with each Phantom Thief bringing something unique to the table! 
Definitely feeling a lot more like a Persona game than a Dynasty Warriors one.

Although it is a shame that the social sim aspect of the original isn't present in this game, the cast and the story of this game is just as interesting! The story makes sure to show off the bonds the members of the Phantom Thieves have with each other, actually presenting them as a group of friends, something I feel the original was missing, and keeps much of the original presentation. Not quite reaching the same highs as the the original, but good nonetheless, carried almost entirely by its interesting and fun characters.

Unfortunately the game comes with several technical issues. 
Due to the pandemic the English cast had to record their lines from home, and it really shows. While their performances are just as spectacular as in the original Persona 5, the audio quality and mixing is all over the place with certain lines being hardly audible, especially near the very beginning of the game, though it does get better and less noticeable as the game goes on.
The game also suffers from terrible aliasing and texture compression that makes it look like the image is built out of Minecraft blocks, and a faulty Anti-Aliasing solution that makes everything look smudged, including the text, which is a real shame because the UI and art of this game ooze style, just like Persona 5! The ability to increase render scaling does help to alleviate some of the issues, so marginally, the image quality can look better than on the PlayStation consoles.
Coupled with a 60 FPS cap and no analogue movement support, makes this merely an OK port.

That is, [u][b]if the game works for you at all[/b][/u]. The version available for purchase right now is filled with many issues that directly inhibit your ability to play it. From infinite loading screens and constant crashes to just annoyingly long load times. With these severe issues seemingly being caused by the Denuvo DRM used for the game as the accidentally released DRM-Free version that came out with the Digital Deluxe edition pre-release suffers from none of these.
Although users have found some supposed workarounds, the best way to fix this seems to be to somehow acquire the DRM-Free version of the executable.

If you are able to overcome the constant crashing and infinite loading times, the rest of these issues are easy to look past though with the fast paced action, charming characters, and the fun times you'll have with the Phantom Thieves in this sequel!

[spoiler] Haru best girl. [/spoiler]

EDIT: Patches for the game seems to have alleviated the severe technical issues this game was suffering from, like the crashes and infinite loading screens.

[b] รีวิวแบบยาว [/b]
[u] ด้านกราฟิก [/u]
เรียกได้ว่าหยิบengineตัวเดียวกับภาคหลักมาใช้เลย มีทั้งในส่วนmodel 3d และฉาก2dแบบอนิเมะสลับกันไปเหมือนในP5ภาคหลัก 
[u] ด้านเสียง [/u]
งานเพลงเรียกได้ว่าเป็นการยกระดับเพลงเก่าๆบางเพลงขึ้นไปอีกขั้นด้วยความมันแบบคูณ2 แต่ก็ยังมีเพลงเก่าๆประกอบฉากเหมือนเดิม สำหรับคนที่เคยเล่นภาคหลักมาไม่ผิดหวังแน่นอน เกมนี้เด่นเรื่องเพลงสุดๆ
ในส่วนของเสียงพากย์ก็ยอดเยี่ยมทั้งแบบญี่ปุ่นและอังกฤษ แต่โดยส่วนตัวชอบเสียงลูลูซก็เลยเลือกเล่นแบบยุ่น
[u] ด้านเนื้อเรื่อง [/u]
ขณะนี้ยังเล่นไม่จบ เนื้อเรื่องจะต่อจากP5ภาคหลักแต่ไม่มีในส่วนของภาคRoyal(เศร้ามากที่ไม่ได้เจอคาซึมิอีกแล้ว) ในด้านการเล่าเรื่องรู้สึกมีความเร่งไปนิดในช่วงต้นเกม ถ้าไม่เคยดูหรือเล่นP5มาก่อนแนะนำให้ไปเล่นหรือดูครับ จำเป็นมากเพื่อให้อินไปกับเกมภาคนี้ได้แบบครบรส
[u] ด้านเกมเพลย์ [/u]

author: d1931cc029ae5174892d8a0f483f61ff
content:
[REVIEW SIN SPOILERS DE LA HISTORIA]

Ya he completado el primer palacio y creo que estoy capacitado para hacer una reseña. 
No haré ningún spoiler, así que leed sin miedo.

Persona 5 Strikers continua la historia de Persona 5, pero no la de Persona 5 Royal. Es importante remarcarlo porque son distintas. De todas maneras, me da la impresión de que tampoco se contradicen en nada importante, así que digamos que también sirve. 

El juego es una mezcla muy interesante entre Musou, juego de acción y RPG. El gameplay transcurre de la siguiente manera:
Navegas por un mapa más o menos abiertos, que son las "Cárceles". Hay unos enemigos a los que puedes atacar/emboscar/ser emboscado, y al hacerlo, comienza el combate en sí, aparecen muchos enemigos, y empieza la acción al estilo Musou. Durante el combate, estás relegado a una zona amplia, pero no puedes navegar por todo el mapa. 
En cuanto a los enemigos, hay una mezcla entre: 
- Demonios/ Personas jefes, que podrían ser los generales típicos de los Musou.
- Demonios / Personas rasos, que tienen sus habilidades y debilidades propias y aparecen en gran número
- Bichos genéricos que están como carnaza. No tienen habilidades especiales pero bueno, atacan y hacen bulto. 

Con los dos primeros, el combate funciona igual que en el Persona 5 normal en cuanto a debilidades y habilidades. Puedes usar tu persona en combate, y si les golpeas con habilidades a las que son débiles, vas debilitando sus escudos, que tienen varias capas. Cada vez que rompes una capa, puedes hacer un ataque extra, y cuando rompes todas las capas, puedes hacer un "All out Atack" para quitarle un trozo importante de vida y quedar guay. 

Los personajes tienen ataque normal, ataque especial, arma de fuego y su Persona. El ataque normal es el combo básico, y si usas el ataque especial tras hacer un número de ataques normales, harás un combo distinto, como en todos los Musou. El arma de fuego es, eso, disparar. Cada miembro usa un arma de fuego distinta. 
Los Persona se usan en tiempo real. Cada habilidad tiene un área de alcance.  
En cuanto a la movilidad, tienes un botón de esquivar/esprintar, botón de salto, y un botón de interacción con el mapa, que te permite hacer cosas como girar en un poste para pegar patadas. 

Es importante recalcar que cada puedes usar a TODOS LOS MIEMBROS DE LOS PHANTOM THIEF DURANTE TODA LA PARTE JUGABLE (DE ACCIÓN), y cada uno es distinto en su estilo. Yusuke, por ejemplo, se especializa en golpear muchas veces a gran velocidad, Morgana se transforma en coche para arrasar en área, Ryuji puede cargar sus ataques especiales para pegar más fuerte, etcétera. Todos los personajes tienen, también, una serie de habilidades especiales que se desbloquean mientras los usas, como por ejemplo, nuevos combos o propiedades especiales. Un ejemplo de esto es una habilidad que permite a Joker dar un ataque más después de impactar un disparo. 

El resto del tiempo es una novela gráfica con exploración básica y conversaciones. No hay conversaciones personales ni Social Links, pero si puedes fortalecer el vínculo del equipo y ganar puntos de Vínculo, que luego puedes usar para mejorar habilidades generales, como por ejemplo, dar más puntos de vida a todos los personajes.

En cuanto a la historia, empieza muy bien, y la temática de viaje creo que es muy divertida. No puedo opinar más a fondo pero si te gustó la historia de Persona 5, seguramente disfrutes esta. 


En general, lo recomiendo muchísimo. Es muy divertido, y la acción es frenética. Tiene lo mejor de los Musou y de los RPG a la vez. Actualizaré la reseña cuando lo termine.

author: 9d13bb95134456519a6a167c390f3830
content: Persona 5 Strikers is a fantastic follow-up to Persona 5, all the while discarding the modern Persona combat in favor of a musuo experience. Fundamentally, modern Persona is defined by its balance between the RPG dungeon crawling and the life sim, tying them together with a calendar. This game removes the time constraints, making the calendar mere decoration. Moreover, social links/confidants are replaced with the Bond system, giving players access to a variety of perks of their choosing. The fusion system itself has also been greatly simplified. With all of this in mind, it seems as though this game throws out everything that made its predecessors special. However, this game gains more focus on narrative as a result of this. Many fun character interactions stem from this focus and smaller cast. It allows the game to take a form all its own, rather than being more of the same. And all the more, the battles still feel very Persona-esque thanks to ailments, follow-ups, baton passes, weakness, technicals, All-Out Attacks, Persona-switching, and more. I can't recommend this if you don't like action games. But if you even have a minor interest and you played the original/Royal Persona 5, then I heavily recommend this game. Also, the baton pass is literally a high five button now and I love it.

author: 004a1f5f7b0d507b83e92cb01d249947
content:
I love Persona. I like Warriors games. This is an excellent marriage of the two of them that's missing some pros of the former while dodging many of the mistakes of the latter. Social links and time management aren't represented here. But we've got dungeons and lengthy story sequences. The different locations can also be explored to purchase new recipes or talk with your teammates. Sometimes they have special items to give you. Strikers has a similar flow to that of Persona 5 and tells a story that isn't completely unlike that one. It's just different enough, though, and it has the same great writing. 

I was worried that the dialogue and plot would feel subpar since this is a spinoff and didn't have the series' main director in charge. But that isn't the case. Strikers looks and feels just like Persona 5 did. The combat is great too. You've got your Warriors charge attacks, except the Phantom Thieves moves all tie in with their Personas. Most of their C3s use the strongest version of their elemental attack, which you can hit enemies with. Once hit with this attack, enemies become vulnerable to a One More attack or All-out Attack. It works a hell of a lot like Persona. You can also summon your Persona, which stops time and lets you think things through. The character's skill lists are the same as you remember them too. If you want to focus on buffs and debuffs while shooting off afflictions, that's something you can do.

It's pretty much exactly what it should be. It's not as long as Persona 5 by any stretch of the mind, but it's still a lengthy game. If you try and do all of the requests and keep going after beating the game, then you can easily put over 40 hours into it. This is a solid port too, even if the anti-aliasing isn't all that great. It does crash occasionally as well, but it's certainly not common. The only thing I didn't like much was how dumbed down fusing Personas in the Velvet Room is. You can't pick two Personas and combine them anymore. You have to pretty much fuse by result with a minimum level and it's not as enjoyable as the mainline games for that reason. Regardless, this is a remarkable game that any Persona fan will likely enjoy.

Overall i would give the game so far a 7/10 with high possibility to increase.

author: 47c6944e04b655459f441cd47df0c12c
content:
First of all, this game is a sequel of Persona 5. Since Persona 5 is a complete game of its own, there are no major plot points that you need to know to play the game. However, you need to know the major characters from Persona 5 to be able to enjoy Persona 5 Strikers. If you have not watched or played Persona 5, please at least read the wiki pages on all the playable characters.

Second, the combat changes drastically from Persona 5 (turn-based RPG) to hack-and-slash (specifically Warrior/Musou style aka the Omega-Force style). Check out the gameplay video if you don't know what this means. Most other major Persona gameplay mechanics remain the same (protag wild card personas, level up, etc).

If you've read up to here and you're okay with everything I've said so far, this is THE GAME for you. 

This game is basically everything you love about Persona 5 on steroid. This game sets during the Summer right after Persona 5 ended. You'd get to see how characters you loved from Persona 5 grow, how they use what they've learned to help people as the Phantom Thieves. One thing that I think Persona 4 did better than Persona 5 is the character development, but Persona 5 Strikers easily outrank Persona 4 on this front (partially because all characters are available and interacting since the beginning of the game).

Don't worry, this isn't just a throwaway Persona spin-off that lasts 10 hours. This is a full 40+ hour Persona game with the good ol' real-life story segments, persona fusing, and all the great cringe moments here too. I forgot it wasn't even mainly developed by Atlus, that's how good it is.

It's a full Persona 5 sequel, but the combat is just a Musou game (again, don't worry. The combat is very, VERY good, and actually kinda addicting. In some cases, it rivals the turn-based combat). If you want the other Persona games to come to PC, buy this.

author: b18ab5e7b3c85beb8e0b435d50301cf4
content:
〇不具合等(2021/02/26追記)
　基本的に、ないと思ってよい印象。自環境では一周クリア確認できました。
　以下は自環境(プロフに環境詳細は掲載)で起きた現象と所感。
　P4Gでの戦闘シーンで巨大キャラクターイラスト表示する際に一瞬固まるようなことが起きていたが、こちらではそういうことが全く起きない。
　PCでの開発になれいるところが作ってると思うと、PCにもコンシューマのゲーム会社が気合入れ始めてくれたのだと感じられて、うれしい。
　クリティカルエラーは45時間程度やって4回発生。
　うち2回はダンジョン移動前のエフェクト中、1回は町移動中、階層移動時に1回。イベント自身のバグではなくスレッドセーフ的なものが原因かビデオカードとの相性が考えられる（同エンジンで別ゲームでも同じ現象が自分の環境ではチラホラ起きているので、かなり局所的な問題と思われる)。
　一部ビデオカードの対応問題か、実機と違う？(コンシューマでやってないので比較できないが、多分正しくないように見える画面エフェクトというかフィルタがある）。
　これら以外は特に問題は見当たらない。
＜2021/02/26追記＞
　システムメニュー(ウィンドウ右上の×ボタン)で閉じてしまうと、場合によってゲームが起動しなくなることを確認(コンテキストを確保できないのか、ゲームを再起動しようとしてもウィンドウが表示されない)。
　Windows再起動でハマり込む状態に陥り、自分は強制的に電源を落として再起動しました(Win10の高速スタートアップは正しく終了していることが前提なので、強制再起動を行うと起動にやたらと時間がかかります)。
　システムメニューで閉じてしまう場合はお気を付けを。

〇シナリオ
　5本編をやっている事が前提の単語や名前が出てくるしキャラクターとの掛け合いもそれ前提なので、そういう意味で言えば「これ単体では完全には楽しめない」と言わざるを得ない。
　ナンバリングはやっぱり専売とかうるさいのだろうか。
　ゲームにすぐ入れる点はよいが、導入が短い状態で済んでいるのは「アフターストーリー」であるからという部分が強いため、これ単体で、と考えた場合、折角のキャラクターたちが浮いてしまう印象がある。
　とは言え、本編を遊んでいる人ならばこれで十分だとは思う。

〇ゲーム
　ゲームについては、戦闘形式がいわゆるRPGではなくARPG。
　基本的には多勢を吹っ飛ばして爽快という具合なので、アクション不慣れな人間でも大丈夫だとは思う。
　ただ、そういう具合なのでチュートリアルがさらっと流され過ぎているきらいはある。
　5本編のように日程など気にしないでダンジョンを何度も出入りできるのは気楽でいい。

〇操作性
　キーボードでの操作性は、初期設定の配置がすこぶる悪い。
　海外のゲームは以前からキーボードが多いので慣れているが、このゲームは敵がワラワラ出るデザインであることを自覚してないのかと感じるような状態なので、キーボード＆マウスプレイの人は再設定した方がよいと思う。
　コントローラーの方は、上下反転させてほしいんだが設定がなさそう。

　というわけで。
　５本編をPCでぜひ出してほしいと切に思うのですよ、ぼかぁさ。

author: c2371f5dfb355ecc93c8409d76081f1f
content:
In progress review...

Do you like Persona 5? Do you like Musou games? Give this a shot! I'm enjoying the game thus far. All the fun writing from Persona 5 is back with amped up fan service and all the excellent full group dynamics that Persona 5 needed more of, along with a couple new, intriguing characters. 

The port is good. No performance problems, no complaints outside of a 60FPS cap. That is a bummer but not world-ending. That being said, the KB+M control scheme is madness. I have no idea how you use it. I recommend using a controller.

I've finished the first jail (think palace) in about six and a half hours. 

In summary, Haru best girl.

author: b98ed74abf485412ac411a27f2ced3ba
content:
ストーリーやアクションのカッコよさは言わずもがな、ですが推奨要件を満たしているにもかかわらずフリーズすることがあります。ただ動作の点に関してはパッチが入る可能性もありますしあまり気にすることはないと思います。
それと特典のサントラなどは音源データを配布するわけではなく専用アプリで楽しむ仕様になっています。つまりスマホに入れて外出先で聴く、なんてことはできない感じですね。
ゲームシステムに関しては、無双ゲーのような爽快感を維持しつつ、本家ペルソナのようにスキルを使って相性の弱点を突いて行けば楽々攻略できるような、いわばいいとこどりになっています。雑魚戦は無双ゲー、ボス戦は本家ペルソナ、というような所感です。
結論としては神ゲーなのでぜひ買ってください。それからアトラスはP3のリマスター版出してください。

author: ed457c5d91dc5421ad7d1c9224de08df
content: P5永远滴神！P5R已经白金通关两遍了，人格面具图鉴全满，COOP全MAX，几个结局也都玩过了。P5算是目前最优秀的JRPG游戏了，生动丰富的日常使每个NPC性格都刻画的十分鲜明，极具打击感的优秀战斗系统与其他JRPG截然不同。传统的日式风格热血剧情，加上契合场景风格鲜明的音乐（P5的音乐真的是非常优秀）。“天下第一”实至名归好吧。。。而P5S，目前没玩多久，就开场的内容来看基本是原汁原味儿的,画面细节提升很大，但日常地图的开放性有所降低，原版的日常NPC基本都无了COOP关系也没了。加入了BAND的新系统来代替原来的COOP系统。战斗方面，P5原版的战斗系统手感本就十分优秀，P5S在保留原版战斗系统的基础上加上了无双的玩法，使得战斗的玩法有了新的的体验。P5S本就是粉丝向的游戏，剧情是P5无印的后续。不过从未接触过P5的玩家也不必当心，说是续作，但是跟前作的剧情基本没有过多的联系。唯一有影响的可能就是对于怪盗团的伙伴们会不太了解（佐仓双叶yyds），对于一些原版的梗也会一脸懵逼。不过问题不大，不算很影响观感和游玩。总体来说，对比P5无印和P5R还是有差距的。P5S算是A社新的尝试，游戏本身质量还算中规中矩。对于非系列粉丝入手也算比较友好。但目前价格还是比较高（日厂定价确实恶心人），如果不是粉丝或者非常喜欢，建议还是等打折再入。

author: 50d4f5a7d67d56aabda67cd45f0a2ca3
content:
Un perfetto sequel di Persona 5 che unisce la componente "warriors" all'iconico sistema di combattimento della serie Persona. La soundtrack è superlativa come ogni gioco della serie: ogni traccia si adatta benissimo al contesto (gradita l'inclusione di alcune tracce del gioco originale). La traduzione in italiano è ottima ed incarna perfettamente lo spirito dei personaggi. La storia fin ora sembra interessante e con i personaggi nuovi integrati egregiamente all'interno del nuovo arco narrativo. A differenza della Deluxe edition di P4G, nel pacchetto è inclusa un'applicazione che racchiude tutti i contenuti bonus: ha uno stile molto carino e permette di accedere a tutte le OST, un artbook interattivo e il behind the scenes. 

Dopo 112 ore l'ho finalmente completato al 100%, quindi posso valutarlo da sotto tutti i punti di vista.

PORTING SU PC

Soprattutto nei primi giorni dopo il day one, il gioco soffriva di molte problematiche: crash improvvisi, ritardo dell'audio, etc... Ma ora, grazie alle due patch rilasciate, l'esperienza di gioco è migliorata di molto. Anche se c'è ancora molto da fare, Atlus è definitivamente sulla buona strada. A livello tecnico è accettabile (almeno finché non rilasciano nuove patch).

GAMEPLAY

L'utilizzo delle diverse combo per attivare le abilità delle diverse Personae può risultare all'inizio un pò difficile da capire, ma è una di quelle cose che si imparano solamente giocando e perciò non risulta infine fastidioso. È stata una scelta necessaria per adattare lo stile "Musou" alla serie Persona, insieme ai vari stili di combattimento dei personaggi che risultano molto fedeli alle loro personalità. Al di fuori del campo di battaglia è tutto identico a Persona 5: la componente stealth e le interazioni sociali. Quest'ultime mancano però del sistema dei "Confidant", a causa della brevità del gioco (la vicenda si svolge in circa un mese nel gioco), ma questa mancanza non si fa sentire, grazie alla scorre

STORIA

Alternati a momenti divertenti, sono presenti anche momenti di estremo spessore e significato. Lo sviluppo dei nuovi personaggi rispecchia pienamente lo stile degli altri giochi della serie e regala molti spunti di riflessione. Per il resto i "vecchi" personaggi si rifanno al loro character development del precedente gioco. Nulla di male contando che Persona 5 Strikers è un sequel effettivo del Persona 5 "vanilla", perciò non è presente alcun riferimento alle aggiunte della versione Royal.

Estremamente consigliato a tutti i fan della serie Persona e per chi desidera "entrare" in questo mondo, consiglio di recuperarsi gli altri giochi nell'attesa di vedere Persona 5 Royal su Steam

author: 82f01323b9b959aab7a6bee609e1aac3
content:
*SPOILER FREE*
Persona 5 x Warriors series seems like an idea that shouldn't work but somehow it pulls it off amazingly

There have been multiple times I've genuinely forgot that this was not actually a regular persona game, running about the city talking to everyone, the interactions between characters, the cutscenes and music all just felt so natural. Even the combat itself doesn't feel out of place and seamlessly flows in and out whenever fights start.

This game has all the elements of persona 5 woven into it in an interesting way, things like baton passes, follow up attacks, persona fusing and all out attacks are still here but made to fit the hack and slash gameplay of a warriors game.
The difficulty is actually decent for one of these type games too, usually you just mindlessly mash buttons and feel good taking out thousands at a time but here there are fewer enemies on screen and a harder fight overall, the bosses themselves are also unique and are much more challenging than anything found in its similar titles.

The music to this game shattered my expectations, I assumed it would be good already seeing as both of the franchises have amazing music already but they really outdid themselves. I got the legacy music pack expecting to flick to that but so far i haven't even wanted to incase i missed out on any of the incredible new tracks.

The DLC for this game in terms of items is definitely skippable, it honestly doesn't do much at all and so far I haven't used any of it myself. The persona level up points may come in handy eventually but the skills haven't really been necessary, they already give you tons and if you have played a persona game before then you already know how to fuse your way to victory.

The story takes place after regular Persona 5 and not Royal. As such some players of the newer version may notice differences in character portraits or persona passives in fusing. The new character from royal also doesn't make an appearance but there are plenty more new faces added regardless

The only real gripe I have is that the game looks similar to the ps3 version of P5 and the text is a little off putting at first. I eventually got used to it but I wish there were options to make it look a bit smoother. Other than that it runs fine during gameplay with the occasional crash which can be annoying though it throws so many opportunities to save at you that the most progress I lost was 1 cutscene that i skipped upon reloading anyway.

Overall I'd say this is the most amount of effort of any Koei-Tecmo mainline or spin-off game and even people who don't like their usual stuff should give this one a shot. If you are a fan of persona 5 then you really don't want to miss out on this.

author: ccc37fc1f064512096fd45b5776ef3d6
content:
Pros

the story is a great follow up from persona 5 (and a lot of references so far)
the most engaging persona game out there i guess
everything looks very detailed
no time stress like in persona 5 (days only progress if you continue with the story)
you can go in and out of dungeons without penalty
no social links since that would not fit the story (now replaced with a skill tree and bond level)
the hard difficulty is not easy

meh

uses denuvo anti tamper (i dont mind at all but it would be nice if its removed when it lost purpose)
60 fps capped (i do play on a 165hz monitor but 60 fps is still kinda doable imo i guess it just starts hitting me at 50)

cons

the anti aliasing could be better (after a while you get used to it though)
unless you like having your hands all over your keyboard i suggest using a controller (even if you don't use one often like me)
it did crash 4 or 3 times in the hours i have now but it can be hardware issues (still id recommend to save at least every hour)

specs

1050ti (power on hours 6515)
intel core i5 6500 (power on hours 6515)
M.2 512 GB (WD black) (power on hours 6515)
4x4GB DDR4 ram (2 of them 2133MHz and two of them 2400MHz)
the game runs fine 60 fps on max settings
some dips in performance when i see like 40 shadows (rarely happens at the same time) or yusuke's showtime
but then again you don't get to move anyway during a showtime

author: d4a9b659f8be53dd9417b1a5e8daabbe
content:
As a massive fan of the Persona franchise, this game is fantastic. The style, story, music and all the other things that made Persona 5 great is here. The combat is also fantastic, as they have managed to take what was great about Persona 5's turn based combat, and translate it perfectly into real time action combat.

If you enjoyed Persona 5, I highly recommend this.

DISCLAIMER: If you have not played Persona 5, DON'T play this. The game is a direct continuation of Persona 5, and assumes you have already played Persona 5. Events that happened in Persona 5 and essential character backstory are frequently referenced in this game. It honestly baffles me that Persona 5 is not on PC, given that it is basically a requirement to play this game

author: 80fbf492f414586ba66892071ce40bc5
content:
P5天下第一！！！P系列和现实的联系真是很紧密，甚至有时候是游戏发售后现实才发生类似的事件，你前脚抱怨哪会有这种事，后面现实的荒诞就给你打脸，属实是现实主义和预言作品。顺带一提之前差点被无双给骗了，先不说剧情香的一批，这个战斗方式更像是把回合制战斗改成即时战斗，打弱点配技能嗑药一样都没少的说。
P.S.本作为P5结局半年后的故事接续，非P5R接续(P5R相对P5而言增加了一些角色和一部分剧情)。

ペルソナ３以降のペルソナファンです。
(※クリア済み PS2版「ペルソナ3フェス」、PSP版「ペルソナ3 ポータブル」、PS3版「ペルソナ5」、PS3版「ペルソナ4 ジ・アルティマックス ウルトラス」PC版「ペルソナ4 ザ・ゴールデン」)

本作品は去年の2/20に発売されたPS4、Switch専用ソフト「	[url=https://p5s.jp/]ペルソナ5 スクランブル ザ ファントム ストライカーズ[/url]」のPC版です。
なので、ゲーム本編などのレビューは他の方にお任せし、自分はPC版でできることを書いていきます。

ゲーム本編の追加要素はないですが、ゲーム内の言語を英語、フランス語、イタリア語、ドイツ語、スペイン語、韓国語、中国語（繁体字）から、音声を英語もしくは日本語から選択可能になりました。
[u](ゲーム内言語を変える場合はゲーム内からではなくSteamから設定を変える必要あり)[/u]
実は北米版なども同時に発売になっています。恐らくですが、ローカライズ版に合わせてのPC版発売なのでしょう。

コンシューマーとの違いの一つにサウンドトラック、デジタルアートブック、メイキング映像がデジタル豪華版についていることです。
[u]ただし、P4Gのようにサウンドトラックはmp3などの形式ではなく上記三つを閲覧するための専用アプリから聞く必要があります。[/u]

そしてPC版なので自分に合わせた設定でプレイできます。
プリセット設定の「高」でこちらの環境では（GTX1660S）60FPSを余裕で出ていました。
ただ、このゲームはフレームレートが制限されているようで、60FPS以上は出ないようです。
（設定項目から30か60か選択できます。）
で、肝心の画質ですが、[b]PS4などとの明確な差は感じられませんでした。[/b]
理由としてはジャギーの多さ。
このゲームはもちろん、ジャギーを軽減するアンチエイリアスの設定項目があり、オンにすることができます。
ですが、効果があまり感じられません。	[u][b]特にキャラクターに関しては。[/b][/u]
ゲーム紹介の画像そのままの画質とお考え下さい。
また、UIもジャギーが非常に目立ちます。ペルソナ5はUIがとても特徴的なためここもマイナスポイント。
[b]ちなみに、ゲーム途中に挿入される3Dイベントシーンはとてもきれいにアンチエイリアスがかかっており非常にきれいです。[/b]これが本編などでなぜできない。

それに追加するように、[u][b]日本語フォントの透過がおかしく、滲んでいたり、虫食いのようになっています。[/b][/u]
例えば「入口」という文字がスクリプトに書かれているとしましょう。
ですが、フォントの切り抜きがおかしいせいか入○に見えます。
また、文字が滲んで、線がつぶれている関係でかなり漢字が読みずらくなっています
フォント自体はペルソナ5から使われている「[url=https://fontworks.co.jp/case/3471/]スランプ[/url]」が使われています。
そして今作でも使われているわけですが、ここまで滲んでなかったと思います。
コンシューマ版を先ほど引っ張り出して比較してみましたが[u][b]明らかにおかしいです。[/b][/u]
また、UIにもその影響があるのか、ステータスバーや、「ナビのハッキング進行状況」の解像度が低く、汚く見えます。
[strike]自分が変なのかと思うくらいでした。[/strike]

[b]ストーリーが重要となるRPGで上記二点はゲームに対する没入感が損なわれてしまいます。[/b]
コンシューマ版が発売されてから、ファンとしても非常に楽しみだったためにこれらの弊害がPC版になり現れたのが非常に残念です。もしこれらが修正されるのならおすすめできますが、現状このままならそうしたくてもできません。
せっかくのPC版なのだからコンシューマ版とは格別の体験をさせてほしかったです。

ゲーム本編はとても面白く、新しい怪盗団の仲間がいかにも「ペルソナ5らしい」悩みや、葛藤があり好感が持てました。自分はこの作品がほかのペルソナシリーズ並みに好きです。
おそらく、二週目もプレイするでしょう。

ですが、正直、コンシューマ版と画質が同じでフォントがひどいなら、コンシューマ版買えばよかったです。

content:
The plot of the game's opening concerns Belle Delphines shadow giving people the Simp Plague. 10/10 (I am not joking)
Gameplay feels like Persona 5 with real time combat. The GUI, music, feel, even real world of P5 has been brought over. This is the first time I liked a warriors spinoff. Unfortunately, the game's handling of SP results in tedious exiting and reentering the metaverse. The original game expected you to return to reality after running out, but here, exiting doesnt move the calendar, and there's nothing else to do but to keep going, so you are contsantly backtracking to checkpoints and reentering. Also, watch out THERE IS NO AUTOSAVE.
8/10. Noice.

期待P5R登陸STEAM！

author: 590196590b095dbb8909f1a13484fd25
content:
I'm actually very, very surprised. So, a little thing about me, Persona 5 is my favorite game, of all the one's ive played, and i've played it through several times and royal the same. So when i hear about a spin off of my favorite game, i'm not only skeptical, but i feel like i had a higher expectation for this game than other games. This is a very promising game, as of current i'm only on the second (To not spoil) "Part". It's not just a Dynasty warrior style game with a shiny persona coat of paint on it, as it presents more of a different style and challenge than the normal copy pasted format.

The story is on par with any other persona style story: Very engaging, very in depth, and full of small fun ventures of the phantom thieves in their everyday lives as teenagers. The thing that surprised me was the game play itself. It's not just a copy or direct version of a "Warriors" style of game, but offers more of a twist on the combat. With the resistances of not just the larger personas, or the "Generals" in the other warrior games, but even all of the small fry shadows that liter the battlefield. You have to be mindful of all the resistances, all the weaknesses, and all of your parties SP and HP gauges, allowing there to be a higher skill ceiling for you to pull off some sweet ass combos. 

I also really enjoy that the game is difficult, it's not just "Smash square to kill all the enemies" like other warriors games, but it really makes you wary of all the enemies at the same time, and makes you use some brainpower to play. There are only three difficulties (Maybe more later or once i finish the game) But the game is definitely more of a challenge than i was expecting.

Overall, this is a really fun game. Maybe i'll update this review later once i beat the game, but for having a 14 hour save and only on the second part, i'm looking forward to how much content there is in the game, and how much more fun i will have with this game. If you like Warriors style games, this is an easy grab, just expect it to be harder than usual. If you're a persona fan, it's got all your favorite characters, plus some new ones (Especially one super adorable character), and it currently has the persona style story. I'm a fan Atlus, you did it for me.

author: d96b727380bc59869f6661cebe410c57
content:
TL;DR - If you really enjoyed playing Persona 5 (and have finished the game), then this game is for you.

If you've played/finished Persona 5 then this game is highly recommended as it continues the story from there. Although in this game it changes from a turn-based gameplay into an ARPG format, it doesn't mean that you can simply turn your brain off and monkey brain button mash your way through the levels (unlike the Dynasty Warriors franchise). You'll still need to acquire "some strategy" in order to not get completely rekt as you progress though the story. The game honestly feels more like a Persona 5 game with ARPG mechanics  rather than another Dynasty Warriors game. Plus, prior knowledge from playing Persona games in general (persona weaknesses, all-out attacks, etc) just adds to the level of expertise that you'll gain from playing this game.

author: fe3ddef015ce5e5a8700c081fbec6c44
content:
さっさと感想を述べると、ゲーム自体は１人目のボスを倒した頃には「面白い！」ってなってました。
そしてこれから買う人でカメラが勝手に動いて邪魔すぎ……と感じた人は

[h1]コンフィグで「カメラオート移動」を切ったほうがいい。[/h1]

最初これの存在に気付かないで遊んでいてカメラワークの癖が強すぎると思ってました。
これ切ってないと正直酔う人多いんじゃないかと。普段スチームで３Dゲー遊んでる人にはいらないだろって感じです。


■ゲーム的には無双系というよりもエンカウント方式まじりなのでテイルズよりかもしれません。戦闘終了時はシームレスっぽい感じでこちらの方が好きです。スピーディーですし。
ただ序盤は全体的にゴチャゴチャしていて、QTEっぽい表示になれるまでは結構気になりました。

ただまぁ慣れたら普通のP5の戦闘より、こっちの方が個人的には好みかもしれない。
UIはP5のほうがセンスよく感じましたけど。

無双系を期待すると、コマンドによっては時が止まる為、テンポが悪く感じるかもしれません。（逆にアクションが苦手な人には余裕ができていいかもしれないです）自分の場合は物語がオープニングに追いついた頃には色々と慣れたのか、結構楽しくなっていました。

あと気になったのは雑魚と強敵の差がかなり激しい所と、一部のスイッチがサードアイでも光らなくて発見しにくい所かな。


■処理的なもの？
最近ゲームをやってるとPCの調子が悪いのか変な処理落ちすることが多いのですが、このゲームは安定してます。スイッチ向けにつくられた作品だったと思うので、結構処理を軽くする努力がなされているのかもしれません。クラッシュも１度もないです。


■コンフィグ部分
パッドのボタン設定に、いくつかまとめて設定される部分があり、分けて設定できないのが気になりました。


■ストーリー
ペルソナ５の後日談なので、ペルソナ５をやってないとわかりづらいかも。でもなんだかんだ面白いので割り切る人は楽しめそう。（主人公たちのやり取りは見ていておもしろい）
日本各地を巡るっぽいのもグッド。


どうでもいい話ですが、とあるキャラで遊んでいて、スケボーが出てきたときは「バイクでやれよ」と心の中でつっこまずにいられませんでしたｗ

content:
Although im just getting started with the game I am already having a blast.

some things i will note is that you should play Persona 5 before this if you want the context and also enjoy the story more, It is still a stand alone game and you don't need to play the previous one but i feel like you will just miss the emotional connection.

The controls can feel a little clunky and minor bugs here and there overall the visuals are great. I get that typical persona feel I got when playing the the base game. I do think that it is a steep price but i have no idea how long the game is so it might be worth the price but i will say it is worth the money but opting to wait for a sale might be the better idea in this case.

If i were to give a rating on this i would give it a 75/100 since there are a few nuances and isn't the greatest  but still a really enjoyable game and would highly recommend especially if your a persona fan

author: 173524ad2781540d8e6affbfe713d2b0
content:
Should you buy this if you haven't played Persona 5? No. This game is all about one more experience with the crew. You would really be doing yourself a disservice playing this before going through the prior one. 

Otherwise, this game is pretty fun. The music, art design, and dialogue are still great. The combat system is average, and the camera can really screw you over in tight areas. Also, the entire social life system is gone for this one. You don't really ever get a choice in what you do, as the game just pushes you from one event to the next. The characters that return are amusing, but they are snapshots of themselves from the end of Persona 5 so don't expect any real character development. I still recommend this though for fans of the previous game, because the charm mostly remains.

author: 7192218251ff560caab2233b522066ea
content:
8/10, with an emphasis on the Persona more than the Strikers.

Overall I'd definitely give this game a recommendation, but moreso if you're a fan of the Persona games and if you played the original. As a Dynasty Warriors crossover, I feel it's a bit lacking? It doesn't quite have that 'one versus a thousand' feeling of being a badass, combat is a bit more small-scale and implements a lot of Persona gameplay for better or worse. 

The story's been great so far, the new characters are really interesting, and goddamn does the P5 aesthetic continue to kick ass.

Like I said, an overall recommendation from me, but I'm not exactly sure who this gameplay's intended for, while it's not *bad* it doesn't really appeal to me as a Persona fan, nor as a Warriors fan. It's a strange blend of the two that will probably work for you more if you *don't* share a fondness for both source materials, oddly enough. But it's still fine for what it needs to do and you should be here for the story. The gameplay's not bad enough to detract from that.

author: 66f77d730e215803ba60c247104b5de5
content:
I'll try to go into some detail about why I don't recommend the game, but first I'll give a shorter version to be concise.

[h1]TL;DR:[/h1]

The game is reasonably fun, but the Warriors-style combat does not mix very well with the Persona aspects.
The subtle parts of writing, which the Persona series is well-known for, is missing almost entirely here.

Is this a [i]BAD[/i] game?
No, but I am forcing myself to complete it, vs. doing so because I enjoy it.

[h1]The Long Version[/h1]

I could ramble for a while, but while playing, I found myself consistently complaining to myself about several several issues, which other games (including games from both the Persona series, and the Warriors games) do better, which lower my overall enjoyment of the game.

* Persona-series influence on combat
* High-level structure of the game, and clashing elements

Before I go into some of these, I want to point out, there are other topics I [i]could[/i] talk about at length, but won't be. These include things ranging from plot issues (like barely acknowledging any fallout from Persona 5 original), to technical things (if you DPS bosses well enough and fast enough, it will overlap voice lines, and you often can't pay attention to them anyway because real-time boss fight).

Just know these are not exhaustive, they are just the largest issues I feel I can convey well.

[h2]Persona Mechanics + Combat[/h2]

This game features Warriors style combat. You know, huge crowds of enemies, relatively simple combos, flashy animations, lots of characters. All of that.

However, it [i]also[/i] makes use of aspects from the Persona series. Such as type-affinities, 1-More, All-Out-Attacks, and more.
The game reflects type weaknesses in a way that makes sense for Persona, but is less-than-idea for an action game; if you are fighting an enemy with a weakness, they generally have damage resistance against anything other than that weakness.

Mini-boss or "tough" enemies have this especially bad. They may only have ~200HP, but without hitting weaknesses, you will do chip damage (maybe 2-3 each hit).

This encourages you to use any attacks with that element, and not too much else. Attacks which don't affect weakness are often more risky than helpful, as you will commit to animations, which are doing chip damage, and leave you vulnerable (yes you can often dodge/dash-cancel out of these, but not 100% of the time).

This means that will often flail wildly between trivial, and a huge pain.
Because enemies either flinch from any attack, and have barely 20 HP, or they have boatloads of health, and Hyper-armour most things aside from their weaknesses.

[h2]High Level Structure[/h2]

The Persona series is mostly built around doing dungeon delves where you have to weight whether to keep going, and risk dying/failing, or retreat, and keep some progress, so you can get a full-heal and so some socializing to potentially get Social-Link/Confidant perks.

This game is not a normal Persona game, it's an action game. However, checkpoints are generally plentiful, you can mostly leave the dungeon/Jail whenever you want, and get a full heal + SP recovery. The only cost is loading/transition times.

This means that each miniboss or serious encounter has to be tough enough to be a threat to you from full HP & SP, or you could just get a full heal (similar to issue with Skyrim, Breath of the WIld, and similar "you can eat your inventory" games).

Is this necessarily a problem? I... don't know?
It certainly feels off; if you can leave and heal pretty much for free, is there really any pressure to keep going further than a single checkpoint distance? Are there any benefits?
Because a player may wish to keep going, and not leave after literally every single fight, the game includes many fights which, even at-level, are an ambush + all-out-attack (essentially 2 button presses) away from clearing a fight.

So why have those? Why not just have the more significant/noteworthy fights be dangerous, and full-heal the player after winning each? After all, they can already do that, but would have to wait through loading screens.

Overall, this back-and-forth makes the game pretty tedious.

[hr][/hr]

Regardless of these thoughts, if you enjoy the game, awesome. I don't think this game is abhorrent.

I just find myself wishing I'd stop and replay Persona 5 Royal again.

I figured that if that was the case, "Not Recommended" was the closest to my feelings, and I owed it to others to leave a review.

author: e825f804a57e52c8a87d3d87454fd931
content:
Important note that this is SEQUEL to Persona 5 and should not be your jumping on point for the series. You should play and beat either Persona 5 or Persona 5 Royal before playing this in order to not spoil yourself on characters and events, the game assumes you have beaten that game. 

To sum it up briefly, Strikers takes all the trappings from P5 and mixes in a battle system that feels like an Action-RPG in a musou's trench coat, in which you need to pay attention to weaknesses and strengths of both your team and your enemy. The game runs incredibly smooth as well, though it seems to have a 60 fps cap if that matters at all to anyone. The plot even follows a similar progression to the main game, so it can also be host to bout of nostalgia if it's been a while since you originally danced with the Phantom Thieves.  Most of the time management mechanics have been removed and you don't need to worry about hustling or figuring out who is the best to spend your time with. There are still moments where you can miss limited time items or side requests if you push on ahead without completing them. You can exit and enter dungeons without penalty and are otherwise encouraged to do so to replenish your HP and SP. Combos feel really good and even incorporate Persona skills, so you always have an avenue to attack enemy weaknesses. All the new characters are also great additions as well, and mesh well with the returning cast. 

30 hours in, I can still say that it should provide any P5 fans both a new and familiar experience, and it stands as probably one of my favorite Musou games, based on both the quality of the writing and the fantastic combat.

author: cedd160148e758fc85920a25c3f5bd9f
content:
玩起來感覺很新鮮, 畫面極佳, 出招威風凜凜, 但屬性相剋很亂, 操作複雜, 儲氣、連擊等各人的按鍵方式不同。
極多過場, 別想能不斷地打打打。
全滅後, 可以即場更換人物和裝備重新戰鬥, 並不須要重新再跑一段路。
此外, 這遊戲很重視瀕密地換人, 所以初期要玩得"很好"比較難。(如果不怕麻煩可以靠吃藥打王! 復活藥能補50%血!)

All-Out Attack Pack DLC可有可無, 因為便宜, 所以也是很推的:
- 資金吃緊, 可以一人買少一套衫(第二章能買到的)。
- 技能卡中, 有全體補血和復活術, 可以即學然後用來繼承!

音樂包只是用來換戰鬥音樂: 特點是可以選全部隨機和不播放指定系列的音樂。
_________

注意:
這遊戲是P5的續集, 不是RPG。
強烈建議最少要知道異世界、陰影、人格面具是甚麼才玩(世界觀跟P4G相似), 遊戲內完全無解釋。
P5的怪盜團各人也沒有再作介紹, 但是可以靠維基和看漫畫了解一下。(我只看了P5外傳的漫畫, 加上玩過P4G, 雖然資訊不完整, 但我覺得足夠。)
__________

對於喜歡看視頻或錄影的人:
我錄了幾段戰鬥視頻, 然後發現, 不斷換人, 別人根本不知道我在幹甚麼啦! (笑)
但是, 我仍非常建議自己玩時把打王片段錄起來。打王時有極多對話不停播放, 會被玩家施放技能中斷, 事後可以靠看片補完各人曾經發生過的事。

author: 211791c491015883914766b298959d7c
content:
P5S keeps most of the elements that made P5 / P5R so great, but replaces the traditional turn-based JRPG combat with hack and slash combat. Sure, the life-sim and social links are gone, but for a game that is trying to be a much more condensed and action-centric sequel to Persona 5, I think it makes total sense. I can 100% recommend this game to anyone who has played through P5 or P5R (Seriously, DON'T play this game until you have finished Persona 5).

10/10

author: edc8c27661f357168b0df832c5a44ad0
content:
New review: I was originally going to rewrite the review, but it had comments so I didn't want to confuse anyone who reads this (hello, why are you reading an old review?). The game runs great now. It's run great since they patched it back in June 2021. Now that performance isn't an issue, I've gotta say that this game is incredibly fun. You might say that it's just a coat of Persona 5 on an otherwise vanilla Musou game and I'd say that's pretty fair, but it's a pretty thick coat of Persona 5 and that really changes the flavor dramatically. This is the kinda collab Musou game that can get non-Warriors fans into the genre. I highly recommend this game to anyone that enjoyed Persona 5. I don't know if I'd recommend it to someone who's not played the original, though. It leans on your knowledge of the characters pretty heavily, even if it doesn't really need you to know the original story.



Old review: This might one day be a fantastic game, but right now I've gotta say hold off on buying it until they fix all the bugs. I and numerous other people have had some fairly frequent and obnoxious bugs. I've had to fight 2 bosses multiple times because the following cutscenes cause me to crash to desktop. I'm sure others have had great experiences with this and are completely bug free. I'm happy for them. I'm jealous of them. I think that the gameplay is good, in a restrained Warriors way. I love P5(R) and I enjoy seeing the Thieves back together and hanging out. In short: the game is good, but my experience of trying to play it is bad. 

I wouldn't recommend you buy this at this moment because rolling the dice every time you hit a cutscene feels pretty horrible. When they patch this game to an acceptable level, I'll completely rewrite this review.

author: 4de106827d5255a0b3cfb8e8618862a6
content:
this game is good ol persona 5 goodness and the best muso game out there. the combat is basic muso press attack and combo into special. each characters moves and animations are true to the characters and they all have their own little changes from the others. the persona abilities stop time so you can  choose what skill to use and where to drop it. they even added to sneak attack into the game so you can get the advantage on the enemy. each character get a special showtime attack thats basically a super, you fill the meter and hit them with the showtime. you are able to hold on to it as long as you want until you leave the dungeon. all in all this game is alot of fun and i highly recommend if you are a persona 5 fan. damn this game is good.

p.s. Makoto is still best girl.

author: 36be0882ec735482a829db3f95637aac
content:
[b]*รีวิวนี้เล่นช่วงก่อนวางขายวันที่ 23* [/b]
เขียนเผื่อมีคนไทยคนไหนสนใจ Persona ภาคนี้
อาจจะแตกต่างจากภาคหลักไปบ้าง แต่องค์ประกอบที่ทำให้สนุกกับเกมและความเป็น P5 ก็ยังพอมีให้เสพได้อยู่
เฟรมเรทเราไม่ค่อยเสถียรเท่าไหร่ อันนี้น่าจะมีส่วนที่คอมเราด้วยเพราะเริ่มเก่า 

Known bug : Crash บ่อยมากๆจนหัวเสียเพราะเล่นไปเยอะละไม่มีจุดเซฟให้ก่อนจะ crash ไป บางครั้งเข้าหน้าคัตซีนแล้วจอดำค้างไปเลยก็มี แต่ส่วนใหญ่จะเป็นเวลาเล่นเต็มจอ

เป็นเกมแนวมุโซที่ยังมีกลิ่นอายของ RPG ในสไตล์ของ Persona อยู่ เราจะเข้าไปตีๆมอนแล้วจบเลยเหมือนแนวมุโซเกมอื่นนี่ไม่ได้ เพราะการตีกับพวกมินิบอสก็ต้องจัดการทรัพยากร เพอร์โซน่าและปาร์ตี้ของตัวเองให้ดีเพื่อเอาความได้เปรียบเรื่องชนะธาตุ

เกมเพลย์ไหลลื่นมากๆ ทั้งคอมโบท่าตี และ สกิลของเพอร์โซน่าแต่ละตัวที่ถูกปรับมาให้เหมาะกับ mob battle มีการแท็กเปลี่ยนตัวกับเพื่อนไปมาเพื่อเปลี่ยนแนวการเล่นให้เข้ากับมอนตัวนั้นหรือเล่นอาวุธแบบที่เราชอบ การใช้ของประกอบฉากมาสร้างความได้เปรียบระหว่างสู้ได้อิสระมาก ช่วงแรกๆไม่ค่อยชินกับมุมกล้องเลยทำให้ปวดหัว แต่พอชินแล้วก็ดีขึ้น 

เรื่องของเนื้อเรื่องกับคัตซีนนี่ทำค่อนข้างดีเช่นเคย จะไม่สปอยอะไรเพราะอยากให้คนที่จะเล่นได้สัมผัสเอง จุดเสียอย่างเดียวคือคัตซีนช่วงโมเดล 3D เฟรมเรทดรอปมาก
เสียงเพลงประกอบเป็นการมิกซ์ผสมผสานเพลงของ P5 กับเพลงร็อคให้เข้ากับการเล่นแนวมุโซขึ้นมาให้เข้ากันได้ลงตัวมาก อินกับเพลงได้เหมือนเล่น P5 เช่นเดิม ถึงแม้แนวเกมจะเปลี่ยนไปเป็นแอ็คชั่น

เสียดายเรื่องระบบ Confidant ที่ถูกตัดออกไปเหลือเป็นแค่ Request เพิ่มค่าความสัมพันธ์กับตัวละครเล็กๆน้อยเท่านั้น

โดยรวมจัดว่าตัวเกมดี เป็นอีกครั้งที่มีการพอร์ทเกม Persona มาลง PC ได้ดีต่อจาก P4G อาจจะมีบัคเรื่อง Crash แต่หวังว่าจะแก้ให้ในเร็วๆวัน ก่อนเปิดตัวเกมจริงให้คนซื้อแผ่นได้เล่น

9/10 + คะแนนแฟนบอยไปด้วย
